lead_paragraph: For decades, the union has held the power in disciplinary decisions and whether guards accused of wrongdoing can be transferred.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP, MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and TOM ROBBINS

headline.print_headline: New York State Taking on Union of Prison Guards
headline.main: New York State Corrections Dept. Takes On Guards’ Union Over Brutality

snippet: For decades, the union has held the power in disciplinary decisions and whether guards accused of wrongdoing can be transferred.
abstract: New York State Dept of Corrections and Community Supervision, long seen as subservient to correction officers' union, is striking newly bold tone; internal investigators face enormous challenges in taking on 20,000-member union amid several scandals, including escape of two convicts from Clinton Correction Facility and federal investigation into brutality by officers; will seek to modify union's disciplinary influence over its own members, which is seen as key aspect of corruption.
